intro: Potamogeton stagnorum, commonly known as swamp pondweed, is a submerged aquatic plant found in freshwater environments. It has long, narrow leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant produces small, green flowers that are clustered in spike-like structures. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various organisms. Potamogeton stagnorum is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize sediment and improve water quality.
